title: .NET Developer
description:
We are looking for an experienced Microsoft C# .NET Developer to work in a small team working on exciting software projects. You will work alongside the Architect/Lead Developer to deliver creative business solutions. You must be able to contribute to the team effort in Leicester and also be capable of working with minimal supervision where required and offer some support to junior staff. Occasional direct interaction with customers may be necessary.

Required skills:

  • C#
  • SQL
  • JavaScript
  • HTML, XHTML
  • XML/XSLT
  • ASP.NET MVC

You must be comfortable working with and developing websites and applications through OO design and web technologies: ASPX, Ajax, HTML, DHTML, Web Services, CSS.

You must also be able to work and develop with Microsoft Technologies through .NET (Remoting, ASP.NET, ADO.NET, MVC), XAML, WCF, .NET Framework, Windows Processes & Threads, TCP/IP, RPC, Entity Framework, LINQ

You should be:

  • Interested in, and knowledgeable of, web-based applications, social networking and mobile devices
  • Motivated / a self-starter
  • Organised and structured in approaching work
  • A good communicator (verbal and written skills)
  • Able to understand functional and technical documentation
  • Experienced in working to tight deadlines
  • Excellent in attending to detail and rigorous in testing

About the company and the role?

They are a small, well-respected software company specialising in web-based technology solutions. They are open and forward looking and encourage participation, input and new creative ideas from all staff. Working with their Development Director you will be expected to get up to speed quickly and then capable of working with minimum supervision.

Location: Leicester (city centre)

Salary: £35,000 - £45,000 + Travel/Parking/Meals allowance

title: Software Architect
description:
Prophet PLC is the leading supplier of ERP software solutions to the fresh food industry.

Job description

We are looking for a Software Architect with a background in C /C++ to join our rapidly expanding team.

Based in Coventry and with offices in South Africa and the US, we can offer good career progression and the chance to work on large global projects.



List of duties include but are not limited to:

You will be expected to evaluate and identify software solutions and to work closely with the technical Director in determining and looking at poor-behaving software and finding ways to improve it. Also involved in research, gathering of information, interpretation of data, and finalising a solution.

Documentation is a very important part of this role. Every aspect of our system or application must be thoroughly recorded. These documents will serve as references for new employees and for future maintenance on the system. You must be able to communicate well through writing and be able to create flowcharts and diagrams.

Coaching and mentoring the team will be expected after training and induction The right person will be expected to share skills and expertise with colleagues as well as set a positive example for them.


Job specifications, Standards and Requirements:

  • Broad and extensive knowledge of the software development process and its technologies

  • Knowledge of architectural styles and design patterns

  • Understanding of various coding methods and computer languages (C/C++)

  • Data modeling and database design experience

  • Experience with software development lifecycle (SDLC) processes

    You will be joining a great team and the chance to earn a good salary. We offer a flexible working environment along with the real prospect of contributing to the continued success of the company.

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
Job Description

Location: Coventry, UK

Hybrid working model

Experience: 10+ Years


As an Enterprise Architect, you will be accountable for setting out, agreeing and managing the related information across Infrastructure, Data, Security, Digital and Business domains for group, covering principles, standards and patterns.

Development and maintenance of enterprise level artefacts for guide delivery standards
Ensure security and capability and enduring services
Support product lines, build roadmaps and value streams – bridge strategy and IT execution gap
Support interpretation of business strategy then into a suite of capabilities
Draw in market insight and innovation into technology strategy
Collaborate in IT strategic planning process
Input scope definition, strategic initiatives leveraging capabilities, heatmaps
Development of domains – capability models, heatmaps, data models, data management toolsets
Knowledge of regulatory/risk issues basis of recommending product/technical improvements

Knowledge of working with SAP technology/Integrations


Enterprise Architect: Experience

AGILE – Essential
TOGAF or OO-A desirable
Enterprise level experience across multiple functions
Develop architecture, distilling business strategy into IT related capabilities
Full Solution Lifecycle experience
Developing domain related architecture – Catalogues, Dictionaries, Data Entities, Data Domains

Knowledge of working with SAP technology/Integrations

Working in Product-Centric IT organization, supporting development of product roadmaps






Skills
Enterprise Architect, Business Strategy, Strategic Planning, Togaf, Insight, Data Management, Agile



About Company

Axiom is a global information technology, consulting and outsourcing company and services provider. Our IT solutions empower organizations and individuals throughout the world to maximize value and quality to succeed in today's challenging business environment. As a fast-growing new economy company, we focus our strengths to offer world-class solutions and services through the convergence of technology, innovation, expertise and experience. We provide software consulting, development and IT-enabled services to clients across the globe. We work towards delivering sustained value creation for customers, employees, industries and society at large. Core offerings include data warehousing, middleware development, product development and web-enablement of legacy applications in verticals like telecom, finance, healthcare, manufacturing, energy & utilities, retail & distribution, enablement of legacy Relentless exploration of technology horizons and a Global Delivery Model that is a judicious combination of onsite, offsite and offshore development, offer a complete range of high-ROI business solutions spanning the consulting, technology, operations and process outsourcing value chain.

We are committed to providing solutions that are simple to use and cost-effective, that meet the specific set of needs defined, and that are adaptable to meet future needs.

Our aim is to work in partnership with our clients to deliver innovative and tailored solutions. Listening to and understanding your issues To deliver benefit—rapidly—to our clients. To create a unique customer focus, both in our relationships with our clients and in our approach. To use our world beating, innovative applications and methodologies to deliver high business value to our clients. Attaining senior level commitment to your project. Collaborative working and transparency. Building the right team for the job. Regular communication and documentation. Respecting the knowledge and experience of your staf.

title: Product Owner
description:
UK BASED CANDIDATES ONLY WITH RIGHT TO WORK IN UK

PERMANENT - HYBRID - NOTTINGHAM

SALARY: £65,000 - £82,300 (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

Integration Technical Product Owner

We are looking for an Integration Technical Product Owner to join our IT & Digital Department on a permanent basis. This is a hybrid role with the office location being in Nottingham Centre paying £65,279 to £82,382 along with a market leading benefit package. We need everyone's positive energy and innovative thinking to lead the energy transition to net zero. That's why we welcome applications from all backgrounds and experiences and have a range of flexible working options to suit everyone!

Here's what you'll be doing

The Integration Architect / Owner will be responsible for managing the integration strategy across multiple applications, working closely with our partners to ensure the correct decisions are made about APIs, Event Management Systems, Network Integration and Security.

They will be a technical owner for the API layer, providing guidance and ensuring that our partners are delivering solutions that meet the business requirements.

This role will be a leadership role within a multi team DevOps environment owning the design and structure of the integration layers. It will have visibility of the ongoing costs and ensure decisions are made to optimise the platform.

  • Develop and maintain the integration strategy, ensuring that it aligns with the wider company strategies.
  • Work closely with our partners to ensure that the correct decisions are made about APIs, providing guidance and technical expertise where necessary.
  • Collaborate with other architects and stakeholders to design, develop, and implement integration solutions using Mulesoft and Azure API Manager.
  • Establish and maintain best practices and standards for integration architecture and design.
  • Define and maintain an integration roadmap and architecture principles that are aligned with industry best practices.
  • Ensure that the integration solutions are scalable, reliable, and secure.
  • Promote re-use of APIs and ensure that API designs are optimised for re-use
  • Provide technical leadership and guidance to developers and other team members working on behalf of our partners.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot integration issues, ensuring that they are resolved in a timely and effective manner.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in integration architecture, and provide recommendations for improvement.
  • The Integration Architect will be responsible for making decisions related to integration architecture and design, working closely with other architects, stakeholders, and our partners. They will own the UK Solutions integration strategy and will be responsible for making decisions relating to costs of the platform.

What we need from you

Essential

  • Strong background working with integration platforms
  • Experience working within a DevOps & Agile environment
  • Demonstrable hand-on experience of designing and delivering API’s
  • Strong technical leadership and communication skills
  • Experience with Cloud Platforms (AWS, Azure) and related tasks
  • Experience using Mulesoft
  • Good understanding of API security
  • Good technical understanding of Network Integration such as VPNs
  • Experience using an Event Management System such as Kafka
  • Experience working within a multi partner / vendor environment including offshore teams

Desirable

  • Experience of different Integration platforms and their capabilities.
  • Experience of Identity & Access Management solutions and how they operate alongside Integration platforms
  • Understanding of the ITIL framework and how it can be adapted to suit DevOps
  • Experience working with VPNs and associated network protocols
  • Good understanding of ETL & associated tools.
  • Experience of Salesforce Identity.
  • Accreditation in agile and/or DevOps methodologies

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £65,000.00-£82,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Life insurance
  • Private medical insurance
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

  • Bonus scheme

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Nottingham: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Work authorisation:

  • United Kingdom (required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Nottingham

title: Business Process Analyst
description:
Business Process Analyst – Job Opportunity

Job Title: Business Process Analyst
Location: Lutterworth / Hybrid

Salary: £45,000 - £55,000 + £5k Car Allowance

Our client, a leader in their industry, are seeking a skilled Business Process Analyst to join their team.

Your main responsibility will be to accurately assess business change requests. To ensure this is achieved, you will be responsible for translating business requirements, developing new operational processes, and collaborating with IT functional architects to design solutions that meet the physical and operational needs.

Business Process Analyst Skills / Background -

  • Proven Business Analyst experience
  • Practical experience in process design and process engineering techniques.
  • Capable of following the established design process while continuously seeking opportunities for improvement.
  • Effective project management skills, including the ability to handle actions and tasks within a project.
  • Familiarity with designing test scenarios for new processes.
  • Proficient in developing business process efficiency
  • Experienced in engaging stakeholders, managing customer requirements, and ensuring practical design outcomes meet expectations.

Business Process Analyst Role Responsibilities -

  • Collaborate as a member of a dedicated design team responsible for executing global change initiatives.
  • Take charge of the design creation or modification process.
  • Develop a conceptual design and refine it through cross-functional workshops.
  • Document process flows, estimate timelines, and determine resource requirements for the changes.
  • Take proactive measures to actively involve customers and ensure that the design aligns seamlessly with their processes and expectations
  • Foster close collaboration with IT architects to ensure synchronisation between process and design.
  • Generate standardised outputs for detailed design review and obtain approval.
  • Establish initial test scenarios for Operations to conduct testing.

Company Benefits –

  • 22 days annual leave + bank holidays
  • Car allowance (circa £5k per annum)
  • Company Pension
  • Life Assurance
  • Exclusive Discounts and Deals
  • Internal and external training and development, supporting both personal and business development

This is a fantastic opportunity to work with an innovative business at the forefront of their industry.

Please contact Callum Stainer on 01743 234029 or email c.stainer@greenfield-it.co.uk for more information.

title: Lead Architect
description:
Dynamics Architect Lead
Here's what you'll be doing

The Microsoft Dynamics Architect Lead will be responsible for owning the technical direction and strategy for all applications built using Microsoft Dynamics within the UK Solutions area.
They will be a technical owner for all decisions within Microsoft Dynamics, guiding our partners to ensure they make the correct decisions and ensuring that documentation is kept up to date.
The Microsoft Dynamics Architect will oversee and provide technical leadership to our partners in the areas of technical design, development, security and operations.

Responsibilities

  • Own the Microsoft Dynamics technical direction and strategy for E.ON UK Solutions ensuring it aligns with the wider E.ON strategies.
  • Work closely with our strategic partners to ensure that the correct decisions are made about Microsoft Dynamics, providing guidance and technical expertise where necessary.
  • Collaborate with other architects and stakeholders to design, develop, and implement solutions using Microsoft Dynamics.
  • Ensure that documentation is kept up to date and accurate.
  • Define and maintain best practices and standards for Microsoft Dynamics architecture and design.
  • Establish and maintain an architecture roadmap and principles that are aligned with industry best practices.
  • Ensure that the solutions are scalable, reliable, and secure.
  • Provide technical leadership and guidance to developers and other team members working on behalf of our partners.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot issues, ensuring that they are resolved in a timely and effective manner.
  • Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in Microsoft Dynamics and provide recommendations for improvement.
What we need from you

Essential

  • Strong background in the technical understanding of Microsoft Dynamics
  • Experience working within a DevOps & Agile environment
  • Strong technical leadership and communication skills
  • Experience of building secure, robust and resilient applications using Microsoft Dynamics.
  • Experience with the Power Platform and its capabilities to resolve business problems without causing wider impacts.
  • Experience working within a multi partner / vendor environment

Desirable

  • Experience of different CRM platforms and their capabilities.
  • Experience with Cloud Platforms (AWS, Azure) and related tasks
  • Experience of Identity & Access Management solutions and how they operate alongside Microsoft Dynamics
  • Understanding of the ITIL framework and how it can be adapted to suit DevOps
  • Accreditation in agile and/or DevOps methodologies
  • Microsoft Dynamics Certified
  • Experience establishing Microsoft Dynamics as a CRM within an enterprise organisation
Here’s what you need to know

Our market-leading benefits package includes 26 days holiday + bank holidays, a generous pension scheme, life cover, bonus and the chance to choose from 20 flexible benefits with tax and/or NI savings. In fact, our benefits package recently won the Personnel Today Reward, Recognition and Benefits Award 2022!

As the only energy company to feature in The Inclusive Top 50 UK Employers (our 2022/23 ranking is 15th) we’ve proven that we’re committed to equal opportunities and actively promote a diverse and inclusive working environment, and fairness for everyone.

We realise the best people bring their energy at different times, so we’re happy to talk flexible working and offer a range of flexible working options, including full time, part time and job share.

As a Disability Confident Employer we interview every disabled applicant who meet the minimum criteria for the role.

We’ve exciting opportunities for everyone to develop their talent at E.ON. Our open access, inclusive talent networks provide networking, learning and development for all, building your skills, qualifications, and capabilities throughout your career.

E.ON is committed to being an inclusive employer. We recognise that everyone is different and we aim to provide a working environment where each person feels respected, valued and able to achieve their full potential. We are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. If you require any reasonable adjustments, please just let us know.

At a glance

Reference no.:

218127

Closing date:

25/02/2024

Salary:

£65,279 to £82,382
Get in touch

If you have any further questions in relation to this role, please contact Ailsa MacQuillin on ailsa.whaley@eon-uk.com

About us
E.ON is a privately owned international energy company. Our 75,000 colleagues in 15 countries work daily towards the improvement of technical innovations and user-friendly customer solutions for the new energy world. We are the first large energy company to focus more heavily upon the energy of the future through our three business areas of energy networks, renewable energies and customer solutions.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Date de publication 11/21/2023
Emplacement Nottingham | Royaume-Uni
Entreprise Worldline

Senior Full Stack Software Developer

Beeston, Nottingham

This is Worldline

We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. The solutions our people build today power the growth of millions of businesses tomorrow. From your local coffee shop to unicorns and international banks. From San Francisco to Auckland. We are in every corner of the world, in every part of commerce. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.

The Opportunity

Worldline is a key player in the Rail Retail marketplace – we develop software that is used to sell UK train tickets online, in person and via self service kiosks. As part of our commitment to this industry we are replacing many of our systems that underpin this complex functionality with up to date, reliable solutions. We are looking to add an enthusiastic, organized, innovative and process driven colleague to our team.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities

  • Working collaboratively with the Architects to design the systems of the future
  • Working with the CTO team to ensure quality standards are adhered to
  • Leading the team, giving them direction, ensuring both the Business & Technical strategies are implemented
  • Write clean, secure code, following a test-driven approach
  • Collaborate well with peers, both inside and outside of your direct team
  • Develop expertise in the rail retail business and act as a point of contact
  • Participate in on-going training to stay current in required skills.
  • Embrace new technologies and ways of working

Who Are We Looking For

We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:

  • Extensive experience in developing RESTful APIs using C# .NET, whilst also being responsible for key design decisions
  • Extensive experience in frontend development using Vue.js or Angular
  • Extensive experience in cloud concepts such as containerisation, AWS Fargate, Lambda, etc
  • Extensive experience integrating disparate systems
  • Experience with Azure Devops, including Pipelines
  • Experience with designing micro and macro services
  • You are inquisitive with a strong desire to continuously add to you expertise

Perks & Benefits

At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:

  • Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.
  • Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career.
  • Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career.
  • Have 25 days holiday + bank holidays
  • Have employee private medical cover, access to a virtual GP service
  • Access to discounts and cash backs on shopping *
  • Purchase a range of flexible benefits through salary sacrifice
  • Have an Income protection @ 67% of base salary for 5 years, subject to Ts & Cs
  • Have a Life assurance – 1 x salary if not in a pension scheme, 4 x salary if joins the pension scheme
  • Have Pension – the company will match contributions up to 10%

Application Process

We will endeavour to respond to all applicants within 7 working days. If selected, you can expect a screening interview with a recruiter and if moving to the next stage, there will be an interview with a Line Manager.

Shape the evolution

We are on an exciting journey towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers, people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. With an empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career - wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of 18,000 innovators and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.

Learn more about life at Worldline at careers.worldline.com

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Software Architect
description:
The Original British Motorcycling Company.

At Triumph, we are driven to make the best motorcycles in the world. Building iconic motorcycles that celebrate our past whilst embracing the future - through bold design, original styling, purposeful engineering and a genuine passion for the ride.

This is a strategically important position to lead Triumph’s Microsoft Dynamics architecture. An expert in Dynamics Sales and Power Platform, this role is responsible for architecting new business solutions across a range of 365 products.

The role is responsible for providing technical vision to ensure that the design of solutions and related services follow a coherent, considered path, whilst delivering maximum business benefit.

This role requires significant functional, business process and people skills, to evaluate business requirements over multiple functions and business areas, identify robust value add technical solutions and communicate designs to staff at all levels.

There will be significant interaction with the other functions within the IT department, along with staff at all levels across multiple business process streams. The outputs delivered will be highly visible to the business, so a strong personal commitment to both system integrity and delivering excellent customer service must be evident.

The role will work closely with the IT teams to ensure that IT deliver the requirements raised and approved by the business area.

Full details of the job description and person specification can be found in the downloadable job files.

A variety of competitive benefits, including an enhanced holiday scheme, employee benefits platform and a favourable life assurance scheme. Motorcycle, clothing and accessories are available to purchase at a heavily discounted rate. An iconic place to work; join us for the ride!

Disclaimer: due to the high volume of applications we receive, we reserve the right to close a vacancy earlier than the advertised date. This is to ensure our teams can manage application levels while maintaining a positive candidate experience. Once a vacancy has closed, we are unable to consider further applications, so please submit your application as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.



CLOSING DATE

29-02-2024

title: Software Architect
description:
SharePoint and Microsoft 365 Technical Lead/Architect

6 month contract- Hybrid 1-2 days in the office

My financial services based client is seeking a strong Development Lead / Architect Software to improve our document management solutions using Microsoft SharePoint and Office 365

  • Led development of technically complex systems using Microsoft SharePoint, Office 365 and C#.NET.
  • Is currently hands-on in developing custom SharePoint Add-In and configuration.
  • Has experience working in Agile environment

What We Offer:

  • Exceptional chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope.
  • High-achieving diversified team.
  • Excellent exposure to the latest technology.

We'll Count on You To:

  • Work in Agile Environment to Design and Architect the program
  • Work closely with squad's Product Owners / Business Analyst/Enterprise Architects to understand requirements and advise on technical solutions
  • Architect and design applications and databases in conjunction with the Architecture and User Experience Chapters.
  • Code and test applications.
  • Review delivered applications for compliance with designs.
  • Work with the Quality Analysts to ensure that the framework and coding standards are adhered to.
  • Liaise with users and colleagues globally for the development and support of the software.
  • Provide production support and help set support technical best practice
  • Work with Product Owner and Scrum master on Sprint Ceremonies
  • Identify methods, approaches and technologies that may improve our software development processes.
  • Troubleshooting and Debugging applications.

What You Need to Have:

  • Strong expertise in SharePoint Online, Office 365
  • Hands on experience in SharePoint Online development using SharePoint framework (SpFx).
  • Strong working Knowledge Visual Studio Tools for Office (VSTO)
  • Above knowledge and experience will have been gained in a commercial environment.

Please send across an updated CV if this position is of interest

GCS is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

title: Software Architect
description:
Location: Coventry CV7 9JU (Hybrid working)

Contract Type: Permanent

Salary: upto £80,500

Be part of something big! Help shape the future of gas for generations to come. At Cadent we’re excited to be part of the future of UK energy! We’ve got a clear roadmap that will drive our performance to the forefront of our industry and support the UK government in achieving its net zero targets by 2050.

We’re making a difference through innovation and new ways of working. Together we’re shaping a cleaner, greener future for our 11 million customers whom we put at the heart of everything we do.


As a System Architect, you will deliver and take ownership of a specialist service whilst contributing and ensuring the required deliverables are produced. We are looking for someone who will understand and appreciate business drivers and business capability requirements across gas distribution.


What you’ll get to work on

  • Helping steer the Agile Release Train (ART) by working with the Product Managers and Release Train Engineer’s (RTE’s) to provide the necessary guidance to the train.
  • Working Proactively with the Enterprise Architect to ensure alignment between both the ART and the organisation’s technology landscape and target state architecture.
  • Ensuring system design evolves whilst considering both the practical reality of implementation and architectural intent.
  • Interacting and collaborating with the system team, alongside shared services. The goal of this is to establish optimal architectures and processes for system testing and integration.
  • Providing critical insights, keeping a close connection to the technological and implementation capabilities of the Train in question.
  • Defining Nonfunctional Requirements whilst ensuring that Enterprise Architecture will support these NFRs.

Who are we looking for

  • Relevant qualifications for System Architecture or Solution Architecture
  • Relevant Agile training and certification
  • Demonstrable experience of defining and maintaining an end to end solution design that covers processes, data, security, people and technology.
  • Experience working with Enterprise Architecture
  • Experience working with business stakeholders and development teams to ensure the right design is in place, is understood, evolved and followed to deliver high quality business outcomes that adhere to IT standards and strategies.
  • Agile Delivery experience preferably following Scaled Agile Framework (SaFe)

Why join us

We offer a host of benefits to suit your lifestyle and support your well-being. These include:

  • Annual bonus
  • Pension Scheme double matched up to a total of 18% of salary (i.e., employee contributions of up to 6%, double matched by a Cadent contribution of up to 12%)
  • 25 days holiday, plus statutory days, and an option to buy more
  • Fantastic career development prospects with funded learning options, including support with exams, and internal and external learning and development
  • Strong focus on supporting you as an individual including:

o hybrid working

o flexible working

o strong commitments to ED&I

o generous family provision policies

  • Flexible benefits including cycle to work scheme, salary sacrifice car scheme, insurance, and healthcare packages, plus much more
  • My Offers membership card – offering discounts and savings from hundreds of retailers
  • 2 paid volunteering days per year
  • Free gym access at the Ansty office, as well as a ‘Gympass’ scheme providing free or heavily subsidised local gym memberships

We want our employees to achieve a healthy work-life balance and are happy to discuss flexible working options with you if the role can accommodate it. Let us know about your flexibility requirements, whether that be reduced hours, remote working, flexible start/finish times, or compressed hours, and we will be more than happy to explore what’s possible for the role.


Our Aim

Diversity and Inclusion

Don’t meet every single requirement listed?

Understanding, learning, and celebrating what makes us different, as well as what we have in common, is good for us as individuals and enables us to work better together as one team. Cadent is committed to being an equitable and diverse employer that fosters an inclusive culture for all our employees, therefore, all our employment decisions are assessed based on qualifications, merit, and business need. So, if you’re excited about this opportunity but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification mentioned, we would still love for you to submit your application – You may just be the right person for this role or other opportunities at Cadent.

As a recognised Disability Confident Employer, we are proud to champion inclusion in the workplace and ensure to provide an environment that is accessible to all and supports individuals throughout their journey with Cadent. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments during the application process.

We place great importance on equity, diversity and inclusion, and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Our employee communities Women in Cadent, Pride at Work (LGBTQ+), Embrace (ethnicity and religion), Thrive! (disability) and the Cadent Military Community can’t wait to welcome you!


Circle Back Initiative

As an active and proud member of The Circle Back Initiative, we aim to ensure that all candidates receive a response to their application, regardless of the outcome.

We will be receiving applications until the specified date above, though Cadent retains the right to close this vacancy early without prior notification, so it is advisable to complete your application at your earliest convenience.


What’s next?
To be considered for this role, please submit your application with an up-to-date CV and our Talent Acquisition team will get in touch soon.

To learn more about Cadent Gas and what we do, visit our website at Home | Cadent (cadentgas.com)

title: Rolls-royce Talent Community - It/digital Opportunities
description:
Job Description

Join the Rolls-Royce Talent Community - Rolls-Royce Digital Talent Community (avature.net)

Digital is our future. We’ve been changing the way the world is powered for the last 100 years and are set to revolutionise the next 100. As pioneers, we must continuously innovate to provide the best solutions in the markets we serve, anticipating the opportunities and challenges our customers will face.

None of this is possible without IT providing the digital capability to support our businesses. In Digital, our next generation data services are unleashing unprecedented value for customers in the air, on land and at sea. For you, this offers unparalleled opportunity and fascinating challenge in a complex business.

Join our digital revolution.

At Rolls-Royce, innovation is in our DNA. We pioneer integrated power and propulsion solutions across multiple markets. We embrace the power of data and technology and we aim to be Digital First in everything we do.

We recruit for:

  • IT analysts

  • Security Architects

Follow the link below to join.

Rolls-Royce Digital Talent Community (avature.net)

We’re an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive working environment. We believe that people from different backgrounds and cultures give us different perspectives. And the more perspectives we have, the more successful we’ll be. By building a culture of respect and appreciation, we give everyone who works here the opportunity to realise their full potential.

As a minimum we’re all expected to attend the workplace for collaboration and other specific reasons, on average three days per week.

title: IT Security Specialist
description:
Our client is a leading Technology Company offering bespoke security Solutions to companies across the UK and internationally. They are looking for an ambitious Security Architect with thorough knowledge of security standards, processes, and application of security enforcing measures.

The successful candidate will be responsible for delivering security architect consulting services to customers for designing, building and reviewing secure solutions. This will involve combining broad technical and security skills with communication and business analysis.

Our client is offering a flexible salary of c£70,000 depending on experience. In addition, our client is also offering hybrid or remote working opportunities.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Work with security professionals to understand their concerns and develop suitable architectures to address these
  • Identify solutions and recommend secure architecture to support customer business objectives
  • Capture, analyse and review customer requirements to deliver high quality input into bids and add value to proposals
  • Engage with and communicate with stakeholders and add value to wider team discussions
  • Contribute to and influence new technical developments and advise on appropriate approaches within our markets
  • Undertake technical pre-sales engagements with customers

Skills & Experience

  • Able to design high level architectures using standardised approaches and tools
  • Confident with networking principles (VLANS, Sub-netting, Fibre-Optic Networks)
  • Knowledge of security standards, processes, and application of security enforcing measures
  • Highly analytical and capable of working at different levels of abstraction

As this role will involve handling of sensitive information, all applicants must be eligible to gain SC level clearance, including being a UK resident for the past 3 years.

If you know you have the required skills and experience and would like to find out more, then please apply now to avoid disappointment!

About Express Recruitment

Express Recruitment has been offering exceptional recruitment solutions across the East Midlands since 1987, “exceeding expectations every time” of over 267,000 candidates.

We supply a diverse range of sectors including Engineering, Technology, Professional Services, Languages, Sales & Marketing, Call Centres, Commercial, Manufacturing, Local Authority, NHS, Education and Voluntary organisations.

Not quite found the right role for you yet? Let us do the scrolling for you! Your search for a new role has never been so easy, just fill in our contact form on https://bit.ly/3NHa9NR or give us a call on 0115 924 0010 and we will do the rest for you.

Vacancy Summary

Hours: Full Time, Monday – Friday

Salary: c£75,000 per annum D.O.E

Location: Nottingham, Nottinghamshire (Travel to customer sites within the UK)

Job Type: Permanent (Remote or Hybrid Working)

Unfortunately, we are unable to contact all candidates due to the large volume of applications we receive. If you have not heard from a consultant within the next three days, please assume that you have not been successful on this occasion. Please do not hesitate to apply for other suitable roles in the future.

This vacancy is being advertised on behalf of Express Recruitment Ltd. The services advertised by Express Recruitment Ltd. are those of an Employment Agency.

title: Software Architect
description:
Processia (an Eviden Company) empowers companies to create the world of the future, TODAY. We help propel our clients' innovation process with speed and efficiency. We use a unique approach to accelerate business transformation thanks to consulting and system integration high-end expertise.

To sustain our growth, we are seeking a PLM Solution Architect (Teamcenter) , based in the UK. In this key role, you will work on customer PLM projects and will also participate in Atos PLM competency and business development.

Key Responsibilities:
Provide expert guidance and recommendations to customers on how to utilize Teamcenter PLM to meet their unique business needs.
Facilitate workshops, develop innovative solutions, and collaborate with stakeholders to ensure timely and successful implementation of cutting-edge Teamcenter PLM technology aligned with business value.
Create high-level conceptual solution architectures using both standard and customized applications (if applicable) to deliver comprehensive end-to-end customer solutions.
Provide sales and presales support by providing presentations, demonstrations, and high-level scoping of solutions for prospective customers.
Support in-flight project delivery by being integral to project delivery teams.
Be the principal high-level functional authority on Teamcenter PLM for project and presales activity.
Lead and support the development of Requirements Specifications, Use Cases, and Functional Specifications.
Produce Functional Designs via hands-on demonstration and piloting of designs (prototyping).
Be the ATOS(Eviden) trusted advisor to customers regarding all Teamcenter PLM matters.
Oversee and direct technical teams located onsite, nearshore, or offshore with an expert touch.
Review the teams’ work products with an expert eye to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Mentor team members to help them reach their full potential.
Be willing and able to travel, if necessary, within the UK and potentially continental Europe to ensure success.

Your Profile:
Advanced knowledge and expertise in the Siemens PLM Portfolio, especially Teamcenter.
Excellent presentation skills and understanding of the sales cycle to influence and make representation at the highest levels both externally and internally, formally and informally, establishing confidence and respect for the functions represented and as individuals.
Hands-on experience in integrations with MES & ERP (e.g., Opcenter, SAP)
Knowledge of CAD technology (e.g., NX, CATIA V5/6, Creo), integrated in a PLM environment.
Good understanding of product design processes (for example requirements management, component design, engineering change management).

Additional Desired Skills:
Experience or practical knowledge of formal Technical and Enterprise Architecture methodologies/frameworks.
Continuous Integration / Deployment capabilities with Teamcenter covering areas in Jenkins, GIT, Tortoise, and Monitoring (e.g. Elastic Stacks, Nagios
Knowledge and practical experience of the Systems Engineering lifecycle and delivery including testing.

Security Clearance:
UK DV or SC clearance will be required to work on many of our projects. Hence candidates who either have already got such clearances or are ready to undergo such checks will be given preference.

What we can offer you?

Flexibility and work-from-home policy
International teamwork & collaboration
Work closely with executive management
Have a positive impact within the organization

Sounds exciting? Apply NOW!!

title: Technical Consultant
description:
Processia (an Eviden Company) empowers companies to create the world of the future, TODAY. We help propel our clients' innovation process with speed and efficiency. We use a unique approach to accelerate business transformation thanks to consulting and system integration high-end expertise.

In order to sustain our growth, we are seeking a PLM Technical Consultant (Teamcenter) , based in the UK. In this key role, you will work as a core team member on customer PLM projects.

Key Responsibilities:
Work with Project Management and PLM Solution Architect in developing Teamcenter technical solutions that solve customer business problems.
Directly advise customers on Teamcenter PLM solutions.
Installation, Configuration & implementation of Teamcenter, Active Workspace, Patches & Upgrades, BMIDE templates, etc.
Assist in the provision of estimates for work and report progress on directly responsible project activities
Work with Project Management and Solution Architect to produce relevant project-related documentation, such as functional/technical specifications, relevant to supporting the overall project.
Develop and deliver training material relevant in a Train the Trainer context.
Willingness and ability to travel if necessary (UK & potentially continental Europe).
Participate and assist in client-facing workshops as a facilitator
Coach & mentor junior and graduate PLM Technical Consultants

BSc/BEng degree in Mechanical and/or Manufacturing Engineering, Computer Science, Technology or equivalent knowledge of PLM.
Professional experience in PLM projects (ideally Teamcenter) and consulting environments.
Able to define PLM processes and implement them with customers.
Good understanding of Teamcenter and the Siemens PLM portfolio is essential, particularly in areas such as BMIDE, Active Workspace configuration, and Deployment Center.
Proficient problem-solving ability to tackle Teamcenter technical issues at different levels such as installation, deployment, upgrade and configuration.
Experience of working in secure environments.
Continuous Integration / Deployment capabilities with Teamcenter covering areas in Jenkins, GIT, Tortoise, Monitoring (e.g. Elastic Stacks, Nagios)

Additional Desired Skills:
Experience in the automation of Teamcenter test and deployment activities.
Experience in scripting languages.
Continuous Integration / Deployment capabilities with Teamcenter covering areas in Jenkins, GIT, Tortoise, Monitoring (e.g. Elastic Stacks, Nagios)
Teamcenter and Active Workspace Upgrades and Migrations with Teamcenter 12 and higher.
Integration with MES and ERP (e.g. Opcenter and SAP)
Understanding of both Oracle & SQL databases

Security Clearance:
UK SC or DV clearance will be required to work on many of our projects. Hence candidates who either have already got such clearances; or are acceptable to and able to undergo such checks will be given preference.

Flexibility and work-from-home policy

Have a positive impact within the organization

title: Technical Analyst
description:
You will be responsible for

Primary liaison between the Research and Development Team and the business, as well as distributors and end users; responsible for all activities related to successful capture and documentation of requirements for commercially viable solutions. Leading an iterative approach to discussions with stakeholders to ensure the creation and sign-off of agreed specifications and acceptance criteria. Presenting and reviewing documentation within the R & D team to assist in the evaluation of timescales and costs for identified deliverables.

Providing a high level of accuracy in fact-finding, utilizing the product and technical expertise, asking the questions required, providing suitable suggestions, and where appropriate alternatives, to successfully compile the baseline material required for development activities and decision making.

Detailed discussion throughout the process with the Technical Support, Commercial and Training Teams to support successful data exchange, facilitating a common understanding between all parties with the ability to ensure the intent of the requirement and how best to deliver it is fully understood and agreed upon by all.


You will need

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in Business Analyst or related Product Development role
  • Expert communication and documentation skills
  • Strong analytical skillset and prior experience of workflow analysis, business process engineering and acceptance criteria creation
  • Demonstratable experience in product engineering roles contributing in a technical capacity to successful product delivery
  • Demonstratable experience in working as part of a successful agile product development team
  • Expert MS Office skills

Responsibilities:

  • Documenting acceptance criteria and project documentation in support of agile product developments concerning mechanical, electronic and software development teams and activities
  • Research and evaluate product/opportunity requirements, working closely with commercial stakeholders, system architects, product owners and development engineers to ensure common understanding of requirement intent, context and best possible options for delivery
  • Working with Quality Assurance and Project Management teams to ensure products are validated to meet the intended use; including Product Owners and other stakeholders to develop and execute the required test plans
  • Facilitating evaluation of products by stakeholders, internal “beta” tests, and prototype builds for the purpose of collecting user feedback, assessing viability and driving refinement and evolution of the requirements and the product range as a whole
  • Assisting Training and Marketing teams in creation and maintenance of product documentation

Position Description:

  • Research and evaluate product/opportunity requirements, working closely with commercial stakeholders, system architects, product owners and development engineers to ensure common understanding of requirement intent, context and best possible options for delivery
  • Working with Quality Assurance and Project Management teams to ensure products are validated to meet the intended use; including Product Owners and other stakeholders to develop and execute the required test plans

title: IT Security Specialist
description:
Trusted to see the whole picture

If you’re ahead of the game on cyber security, systems and operations risk we can secure your career ambitions.

Our Security Architects are trusted to work closely with a wide range of clients from all sectors on exciting projects with real-world purpose and impact. Whether you're a self-starter looking to test your talents, or want the opportunity to use your experience and skills, you'll find the challenges and support you need as part of one of the UK's largest cyber consultancies.

Our roles are only available if you hold or fulfil the criteria to obtain a UK Security Clearance.

Insights you can act on

While technology is at the heart of our clients’ digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.

When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees “members” because they are CGI shareholders and owners, and, as owners, we enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today—one of the world’s largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.

At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where everyone belongs, and we collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal opportunity employer, we empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.

Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI—where your ideas and actions make a difference.

Your future duties and responsibilities

You’ll join a collaborative team of more than 230 members delivering 360° security services to clients across every domain that CGI operates in, from government, defence, healthcare and utilities to banking and financial services.

As a Security Architect your innovative solutions and support will secure business systems, protecting what is most valuable to our clients.

You’ll collaborate across enterprise architectures to produce end-to-end security designs, assisting on bids and proposals, as well as implementations and integrations. Liaising with stakeholders at all levels, you’ll help build the full landscape security view that underpins systems resilience and client confidence. We need senior members who are design authorities, and junior members to work alongside them, developing their skills and understanding.

Required qualifications to be successful in this role

We’re recruiting at all levels, so you’ll have between 1 to 30+ years of experience consulting on delivering and implementing secure system design - ideally as a technical security lead for senior roles. You’ll understand why security is at the centre of everything we do, and have the communication skills to persuade others, justifying secure architecture design to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
We’ll also look for your experience and knowledge in:
? Security standards and frameworks (MoD and HMG experiences helpful)
? Cloud-based cyber security principles and architecture points
? Boundary controls, network segmentation and access control
? Identity and Access Management (including RBAC and A/PBAC, permissions management), ZTA
? Cryptographic techniques and implementations
? IT asset management and tracking
? Vulnerability Management and Patching
? SIEM principles, products and supporting logging infrastructure
? Containerisation and virtual machine security
? Delivering secure solutions against project expectations
? Strong awareness of and commitment to industry best practice
? Driving change in a complex environment

This role requires you to hold or fulfil the criteria to obtain a UK Security Clearance

title: Data Warehouse Architect
description:
Do you want to work with cutting edge data and analytics technologies to help our clients unlock their data potential and value?

Do you want to lead and mentor teams of expert technologists on exciting data projects?

Do you want to work in an environment that embraces your drive to learn?

About Us

We're an award-winning innovative tech consultancy - a team of creative problem solvers. Since 1993 we've been finding better, more sustainable ways to solve complex technology problems for some of the world's leading organisations and delivered solutions that millions of people use every day.

In the last 30 years we won several awards, including a prestigious Queen's Award for Enterprise in the Innovation category for our Enterprise Agile delivery approach.

Operating from 26 locations across the world, we bring together teams of creative experts with diverse backgrounds and experiences, who enjoy working and learning in our collaborative and open culture and are committed to world-class delivery.

We want to continue to grow our team with people just like you!

About the Role

We work with clients across all aspects of deriving value from data: from technical implementations like modern data warehousing; through to massively scalable analytics and ML solutions. We help our customers embrace a DataOps culture. We are advocates of Agile methodologies and believe in constant delivery of business value.

Our projects manifest both on-premise or in cloud, often driving business intelligence and machine learning capabilities, helping customers achieve their Data as a Service ambitions.

As a technical authority, you will interface directly with customers representing BJSS' deep technical expertise. You will lead delivery teams by example, providing the insight to enable them to craft great solutions that delight our customers.

You'll mentor others to ensure they see the wider picture and meet our exacting standards, while championing the deep experience they bring.

About You

Technology and data are your passions and you get huge reward from seeing excellent solutions delivered. You're an enthusiastic champion for your subject, and your energy and delivery-focused attitude wins the respect of those around you as a trusted technical advisor.

You're willing to be hands-on when necessary and able to balance innovation and intellectual rigour with pragmatism.

You have a constant drive to learn. You're genuinely passionate about understanding the challenges your customers face and how you can help them.

You'll bring wide experience of the data ecosystem, including: numerous data platforms e.g. Databricks; data modelling approaches; public cloud services including AWS and Azure; a deep knowledge and focus on security and privacy and their applications on data platform implementations; and OLTP and analytical warehouses.

With experience in Agile and C-Level stakeholder engagement, you'll be knowledgeable in the full product lifecycle from discovery to delivery and a champion of quality.

Some of the Perks

  • Flexible benefits allowance – you choose how to spend your allowance (additional pension contributions, healthcare, dental and more)
  • Industry leading health and wellbeing plan - we partner with several wellbeing support functions to cater to each individual's need, including 24/7 GP services, mental health support, and other
  • Life Assurance (4 x annual salary)
  • 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
  • Hybrid working - Our roles are not fully remote as we take pride in the tight knit communities we have created at our local offices. But we offer plenty of flexibility and you can split your time between the office, client site and WFH
  • Discounts – we have preferred rates from dozens of retail, lifestyle, and utility brands
  • An industry-leading referral scheme with no limits on the number of referrals
  • Flexible holiday buy/sell option
  • Electric vehicle scheme
  • Training opportunities and incentives – we support professional certifications across engineering and non-engineering roles, including unlimited access to O'Reilly
  • Giving back – the ability to get involved nationally and regionally with partnerships to get people from diverse backgrounds into tech
  • You will become part of a squad with people from different areas within the business who will help you grow at BJSS
  • We have a busy social calendar that you can chose to join– quarterly town halls/squad nights out/weekends away with families included/office get togethers
  • GymFlex gym membership programme

title: Platform Engineer
description:
About Us

We're an award-winning innovative tech consultancy - a team of creative problem solvers. Since 1993 we've been finding better, more sustainable ways to solve complex technology problems for some of the world's leading organisations and delivered solutions that millions of people use every day.

In the last 30 years we won several awards, including a prestigious Queen's Award for Enterprise in the Innovation category for our Enterprise Agile delivery approach.

Operating from 26 locations across the world, we bring together teams of creative experts with diverse backgrounds and experiences, who enjoy working and learning in our collaborative and open culture and are committed to world-class delivery.

We want to continue to grow our team with people just like you!

Our platform engineers design, build and maintain the delivery infrastructure, systems and processes underpinning technology transformation engagements and lead the adoption of modern platforms and ways of working.

About the Role

We're looking for hands-on platform engineers with deep understanding of the Azure ecosystem to join delivery teams working on some of the most exciting digital programmes around, with clients in a range of industries.

As an Azure expert, you'll work in small product teams alongside developers, architects, designers, analysts and product owners to deliver automation, tooling and cloud infrastructure.

We encourage continuous learning, so as well as the opportunity to work with some of the brightest and best in the industry, and evaluate the latest technologies, we'll reward you for obtaining Azure certifications.

About You

You'll have the expertise and confidence to lead the definition and support of the Azure delivery platform in complex engagements, typically working in multi-disciplinary teams on client site. You'll have:

  • Commercial experience across designing, deploying and managing cloud environments in Azure.
  • Experience of containers and container orchestration using Docker, Kubernetes, and AKS.
  • Experience with infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform, ARM Templates, Helm, or Pulumi.
  • Experience of pipeline build/deploy tools such as Azure DevOps, TFS, or Jenkins.
  • In-depth automation and scripting using tools such as PowerShell, AZ CLI, Python, Bash, Ruby, or Groovy.
  • Detailed knowledge of configuration management technologies like DSC, Puppet, Chef, SaltStack, or Ansible.
  • Thorough knowledge of logging and monitoring tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, Azure Monitor, Azure Log Analytics, Azure App Insights, New Relic, or Datadog.
  • Knowledge of cloud platform design patterns and best practices.
  • Knowledge of common database and caching technologies, such as Azure SQL, CosmosDB, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, MySQL/MariaDB, Memcache, or Redis.
  • Some knowledge of common programming languages used in modern web application development, such as C#, JavaScript, TypeScript, Java, Go, or PHP.
  • Exposure to iterative/agile development methodologies and experience of enabling team delivery through technology.
  • As a bonus, experience of other cloud platforms and technologies.

If you don't feel you match with all the above, we're still interested! We have opportunities across a wide range of skill sets and levels in tech. More than anything, we're excited about people who love technology and learning how to make it work. We'd really like to hear from you, and hopefully find you your dream job at BJSS.

Some of the Perks

  • Flexible benefits allowance – you choose how to spend your allowance (additional pension contributions, healthcare, dental and more)
  • Industry leading health and wellbeing plan - we partner with several wellbeing support functions to cater to each individual's need, including 24/7 GP services, mental health support, and other
  • Life Assurance (4 x annual salary)
  • 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
  • Hybrid working - Our roles are not fully remote as we take pride in the tight knit communities we have created at our local offices. But we offer plenty of flexibility and you can split your time between the office, client site and WFH
  • Discounts – we have preferred rates from dozens of retail, lifestyle, and utility brands
  • An industry-leading referral scheme with no limits on the number of referrals
  • Flexible holiday buy/sell option
  • Electric vehicle scheme
  • Training opportunities and incentives – we support professional certifications across engineering and non-engineering roles, including unlimited access to O'Reilly
  • Giving back – the ability to get involved nationally and regionally with partnerships to get people from diverse backgrounds into tech
  • You will become part of a squad with people from different areas within the business who will help you grow at BJSS
  • We have a busy social calendar that you can chose to join– quarterly town halls/squad nights out/weekends away with families included/office get togethers
  • GymFlex gym membership programme

title: Software Architect
description:
About Us

We're an award-winning innovative tech consultancy - a team of creative problem solvers. Since 1993 we've been finding better, more sustainable ways to solve complex technology problems for some of the world's leading organisations and delivered solutions that millions of people use every day.

In the last 30 years we won several awards, including a prestigious Queen's Award for Enterprise in the Innovation category for our Enterprise Agile delivery approach.

Operating from 26 locations across the world, we bring together teams of creative experts with diverse backgrounds and experiences, who enjoy working and learning in our collaborative and open culture and are committed to world-class delivery.

We want to continue to grow our team with people just like you!

About the Role

We're looking for software architects with broad technical knowledge, full life-cycle project experience and excellent communication skills to bridge the gap between client and engineering teams.

How should our application architecture change and what supporting infrastructure do I need as we migrate to the Cloud?

How do we maintain conceptual integrity of our product design as it rapidly evolves?

How can we quickly deliver the robust legacy system interfaces needed by our Agile development teams?

What do I need to do to integrate data science models into our production business processes and unlock the value of our data?

These are the types of questions that you'll be asked by our clients, your colleagues and yourself at BJSS.

BJSS has developed some of the most demanding systems around using the latest technologies and techniques – from the messaging hub that integrates the whole of the NHS, to an application that uses a leading-edge AWS technology stack to underpin a great UX visualising the flightpaths of every plane in the world – as well as analysing huge quantities of data to improve fuel efficiency, reducing costs and environmental impact. Our architects have always been at the centre of our engagements, managing technical risk and creating real business value.

About You

As one of our Architects, you will use your broad technical knowledge, full lifecycle project experience and excellent communication skills to bridge the gap between client and internal delivery managers, enterprise architects, operations teams, UX consultants and developers. You'll be comfortable evaluating a new Open Source technology in a rapid technical spike, presenting to a CIO on a package selection, or working with a technical tester and a support desk engineer to debug a time-critical P1 issue.

As a technical authority, you lead by example and inspire delivery teams to create great software products that demonstrate the art of the possible. You mentor developers to ensure they see the wider picture and meet our exacting standards, while acknowledging the deep experience they bring from spending hours a day working on a codebase.

You have energy and a pragmatic, delivery-focused attitude that wins the respect of those around you and makes you a trusted technical advisor. You're willing to be hands-on when you need to be. You balance innovation and intellectual rigour with realism. You love technology and want to keep on learning. You're genuinely interested in understanding the challenges your users face and how you can help them.


Some of the Perks

  • Flexible benefits allowance – you choose how to spend your allowance (additional pension contributions, healthcare, dental and more)
  • Industry leading health and wellbeing plan - we partner with several wellbeing support functions to cater to each individual's need, including 24/7 GP services, mental health support, and other
  • Life Assurance (4 x annual salary)
  • 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
  • Hybrid working - Our roles are not fully remote as we take pride in the tight knit communities we have created at our local offices. But we offer plenty of flexibility and you can split your time between the office, client site and WFH
  • Discounts – we have preferred rates from dozens of retail, lifestyle, and utility brands
  • An industry-leading referral scheme with no limits on the number of referrals
  • Flexible holiday buy/sell option
  • Electric vehicle scheme
  • Training opportunities and incentives – we support professional certifications across engineering and non-engineering roles, including unlimited access to O'Reilly
  • Giving back – the ability to get involved nationally and regionally with partnerships to get people from diverse backgrounds into tech
  • You will become part of a squad with people from different areas within the business who will help you grow at BJSS
  • We have a busy social calendar that you can chose to join– quarterly town halls/squad nights out/weekends away with families included/office get togethers
  • GymFlex gym membership programme

title: .NET Developer
description:
We are looking for an experienced Microsoft C# .NET Developer to work in a small team working on exciting software projects. You will work alongside the Architect/Lead Developer to deliver creative business solutions. You must be able to contribute to the team effort in Leicester and also be capable of working with minimal supervision where required and offer some support to junior staff. Occasional direct interaction with customers may be necessary.

Required skills:

  • C#
  • SQL
  • JavaScript
  • HTML, XHTML
  • XML/XSLT
  • ASP.NET MVC

You must be comfortable working with and developing websites and applications through OO design and web technologies: ASPX, Ajax, HTML, DHTML, Web Services, CSS.

You must also be able to work and develop with Microsoft Technologies through .NET (Remoting, ASP.NET, ADO.NET, MVC), XAML, WCF, .NET Framework, Windows Processes & Threads, TCP/IP, RPC, Entity Framework, LINQ

You should be:

  • Interested in, and knowledgeable of, web-based applications, social networking and mobile devices
  • Motivated / a self-starter
  • Organised and structured in approaching work
  • A good communicator (verbal and written skills)
  • Able to understand functional and technical documentation
  • Experienced in working to tight deadlines
  • Excellent in attending to detail and rigorous in testing

About the company and the role?

They are a small, well-respected software company specialising in web-based technology solutions. They are open and forward looking and encourage participation, input and new creative ideas from all staff. Working with their Development Director you will be expected to get up to speed quickly and then capable of working with minimum supervision.

Location: Leicester (city centre)

Salary: £35,000 - £45,000 + Travel/Parking/Meals allowance

title: Software Architect
description:
Prophet PLC is the leading supplier of ERP software solutions to the fresh food industry.

Job description

We are looking for a Software Architect with a background in C /C++ to join our rapidly expanding team.

Based in Coventry and with offices in South Africa and the US, we can offer good career progression and the chance to work on large global projects.



List of duties include but are not limited to:

You will be expected to evaluate and identify software solutions and to work closely with the technical Director in determining and looking at poor-behaving software and finding ways to improve it. Also involved in research, gathering of information, interpretation of data, and finalising a solution.

Documentation is a very important part of this role. Every aspect of our system or application must be thoroughly recorded. These documents will serve as references for new employees and for future maintenance on the system. You must be able to communicate well through writing and be able to create flowcharts and diagrams.

Coaching and mentoring the team will be expected after training and induction The right person will be expected to share skills and expertise with colleagues as well as set a positive example for them.


Job specifications, Standards and Requirements:

  • Broad and extensive knowledge of the software development process and its technologies

  • Knowledge of architectural styles and design patterns

  • Understanding of various coding methods and computer languages (C/C++)

  • Data modeling and database design experience

  • Experience with software development lifecycle (SDLC) processes

    You will be joining a great team and the chance to earn a good salary. We offer a flexible working environment along with the real prospect of contributing to the continued success of the company.

title: Product Owner
description:
UK BASED CANDIDATES ONLY WITH RIGHT TO WORK IN UK

PERMANENT - HYBRID - NOTTINGHAM

SALARY: £65,000 - £82,300 (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

Integration Technical Product Owner

We are looking for an Integration Technical Product Owner to join our IT & Digital Department on a permanent basis. This is a hybrid role with the office location being in Nottingham Centre paying £65,279 to £82,382 along with a market leading benefit package. We need everyone's positive energy and innovative thinking to lead the energy transition to net zero. That's why we welcome applications from all backgrounds and experiences and have a range of flexible working options to suit everyone!

Here's what you'll be doing

The Integration Architect / Owner will be responsible for managing the integration strategy across multiple applications, working closely with our partners to ensure the correct decisions are made about APIs, Event Management Systems, Network Integration and Security.

They will be a technical owner for the API layer, providing guidance and ensuring that our partners are delivering solutions that meet the business requirements.

This role will be a leadership role within a multi team DevOps environment owning the design and structure of the integration layers. It will have visibility of the ongoing costs and ensure decisions are made to optimise the platform.

  • Develop and maintain the integration strategy, ensuring that it aligns with the wider company strategies.
  • Work closely with our partners to ensure that the correct decisions are made about APIs, providing guidance and technical expertise where necessary.
  • Collaborate with other architects and stakeholders to design, develop, and implement integration solutions using Mulesoft and Azure API Manager.
  • Establish and maintain best practices and standards for integration architecture and design.
  • Define and maintain an integration roadmap and architecture principles that are aligned with industry best practices.
  • Ensure that the integration solutions are scalable, reliable, and secure.
  • Promote re-use of APIs and ensure that API designs are optimised for re-use
  • Provide technical leadership and guidance to developers and other team members working on behalf of our partners.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot integration issues, ensuring that they are resolved in a timely and effective manner.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in integration architecture, and provide recommendations for improvement.
  • The Integration Architect will be responsible for making decisions related to integration architecture and design, working closely with other architects, stakeholders, and our partners. They will own the UK Solutions integration strategy and will be responsible for making decisions relating to costs of the platform.

What we need from you

Essential

  • Strong background working with integration platforms
  • Experience working within a DevOps & Agile environment
  • Demonstrable hand-on experience of designing and delivering API’s
  • Strong technical leadership and communication skills
  • Experience with Cloud Platforms (AWS, Azure) and related tasks
  • Experience using Mulesoft
  • Good understanding of API security
  • Good technical understanding of Network Integration such as VPNs
  • Experience using an Event Management System such as Kafka
  • Experience working within a multi partner / vendor environment including offshore teams

Desirable

  • Experience of different Integration platforms and their capabilities.
  • Experience of Identity & Access Management solutions and how they operate alongside Integration platforms
  • Understanding of the ITIL framework and how it can be adapted to suit DevOps
  • Experience working with VPNs and associated network protocols
  • Good understanding of ETL & associated tools.
  • Experience of Salesforce Identity.
  • Accreditation in agile and/or DevOps methodologies

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £65,000.00-£82,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Life insurance
  • Private medical insurance
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

  • Bonus scheme

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Nottingham: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Work authorisation:

  • United Kingdom (required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Nottingham

description:
Job Description

Ensure security and capability and enduring services
Support product lines, build roadmaps and value streams – bridge strategy and IT execution gap
Support interpretation of business strategy then into a suite of capabilities
Draw in market insight and innovation into technology strategy
Collaborate in IT strategic planning process
Input scope definition, strategic initiatives leveraging capabilities, heatmaps
Development of domains – capability models, heatmaps, data models, data management toolsets
Knowledge of regulatory/risk issues basis of recommending product/technical improvements

Axiom is a global information technology, consulting and outsourcing company and services provider. Our IT solutions empower organizations and individuals throughout the world to maximize value and quality to succeed in today's challenging business environment. As a fast-growing new economy company, we focus our strengths to offer world-class solutions and services through the convergence of technology, innovation, expertise and experience. We provide software consulting, development and IT-enabled services to clients across the globe. We work towards delivering sustained value creation for customers, employees, industries and society at large. We are committed to providing solutions that are simple to use and cost-effective, that meet the specific set of needs defined, and that are adaptable to meet future needs.

Our aim is to work in partnership with our clients to deliver innovative and tailored solutions. Listening to and understanding your issues To deliver benefit—rapidly—to our clients. To create a unique customer focus, both in our relationships with our clients and in our approach. To use our world beating, innovative applications and methodologies to deliver high business value to our clients. Attaining senior level commitment to your project.
